title: 6.4 Master Challenge 2
question:
Ms. Nora wants to change a colored image to grayscale. She has the pixel table of the colored image, as shown:

● The value 0 means black pixel.
● The value 255 means white pixel.
● Other values imply colored pixels.
To convert the color image to grayscale, follow the conditions given below:
● Change to a black pixel (0) if the value is less than or equal to 128.
● Change to a white pixel (255) if the value is greater than 128.
Write a Java program to change the color image to grayscale.
__language_type_hint: python - sql - htmlcss - scratch - javascript - R - pseudocode - java

testcases.value:
Case = Test integer sum
input = 1 2 3 5
output = 11

Case = Test integer sum
input = 1
 -2
 3
 5
output = 7
